Class VoronoiMBR<T>

    • Method Detail

      • computeVoronoiMBRs

        public void computeVoronoiMBRs(java.util.ArrayList<D6OO<T,Polygon>> objects,
                               double maxMeters,
                               boolean storeGeometries)
        Utility function in the area of Voronoi computation: compute the Bounding Rects of all Voronoi regions of the given points. The caller passes a list of DDDDO objects with the following meaning
        • d1, d2: latitude longitude of the object's center
        • obj1: a reference to the user data associated with this object, e.g. its ID or name
        The method first computes the Delaunay triangulation. Then it computes a set of vertices for each object based on the triangulation: For all triangles that belong to an object (i.e. one of the three points is the object point), the center of the circle is computed that touches all three triangle points. This point is a vertex of a Voronoi region. If the Voronoi region is finite, then we can compute the bounding rect of this region. If the Voronoi region is infinte (i.e. open) then the maxMeters param is used to compute a bounding rect with this distance from center to border (i.e. the rectangle has a surface of 4*maxMeters meters). To safe memory, the bounding rect and Voronoi region are stored in the given list, i.e.
        • d3: mbr_lat_min
        • d4: mbr_lat_max
        • d5: mbr_lon_min
        • d6: mbr_lon_max
        • obj2: the Voronoi region as polygon (if desired and if the region is not infinite). If the polygon is larger than a bounding rect around maxMeters from the center point, it is clipped to this rect
        Parameters:
        objects - the list of objects as described above
        maxMeters - used to compute the MBR for infinite regions
        storeGeometries - should finite Voronoi regions be stored as Geometry in the objects list
